greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of all possible sums formed from all but one of the previous terms, starting 1.
comment: Apart from initial 1, same sequence as A001563. Additive analog of A057438.
a(1) = 1, for n >= 2: a(n) = sum of previous terms * (n-2) = (Sum_(i=1...n-2) a(i)) * (n-2). a(n) = A001563(n-2) = A094258(n-1) for n >= 3. - _Jaroslav Krizek_, Oct 16 2009
link: Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
formula: G.f.: x*T(0), where T(k) = 1 - x^2*(k+1)^2/(x^2*(k+1)^2 - (1 -x -2*x*k)*(1 -3*x -2*x*k)/T(k+1) ); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 10 2013
a(n) = S1(n,1) - S1(n-1,1), where S1 are the unsigned Stirling cycle numbers. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 10 2016
example: a(2) = 0 as there is only one previous term and empty sum is taken to be 0.
mathematica: In[2]:= l = {1}; Do[k = Length[l] - 1; p = Plus @@ Flatten[Select[Subsets[l], Length[ # ]==k& ]]; AppendTo[l, p], {n, 20}]; l (* _Ryan Propper_, May 28 2006 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 29 2004
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 29 2006
